participant_1.name: Megan
participant_1.personality: Thoughtful and creative, with a deep appreciation for art and performance.
participant_1.background: I juggle for a living in a circus, and I come from a small town in the Midwest. Since my dog died I am incomplete. My father is a wildlife veterinarian and my mother is an animal rights activist. I was too scared to come out to my parents on my last birthday, so I just spent the day with my friends. Others think I'm weird because I'm a health nut but still love sweets.

participant_2.name: Jake
participant_2.personality: Optimistic and adventurous, always looking for new experiences and ways to help others.
participant_2.background: I lost my dog to cancer. I don’t have a college degree. Helping people and trying new things are two of my favorite things to do. I ate pancakes with extra syrup and bacon for my birthday breakfast. Nike cleats are my favorite.

content.text: Going okay, I lost my dog to cancer last year but I'm still getting by. How about you?
I'm sorry to hear that, I lost my dog too and it was really hard. I'm doing well, I'm a juggler in a circus.
That's awesome! I have always wanted to learn how to juggle.
It's not too hard, I'm sure you could pick it up if you tried.
Maybe I will, it sounds like a fun skill to have.
It is, you can entertain people at parties and stuff.
That would be cool, I could also learn new tricks.
You definitely could, there are a lot of different things you can juggle.
I'm going to have to look into it, it sounds like a really cool skill.
It is, and it's not as hard as it looks.
Good to know, I'm going to have to start practicing.
You should, it's a lot of fun.
I'm sure it is, I'm excited to try it.
